Housekeeping. There were accumulations of hay, dirt, debris, guinea pig excreta, and loose insulation covering the floor
of the animal room and along the side wall by sink and trash can. Piles of empty feed bags, trash, cardboard boxes, and
equipment were present in the back corner of the room and along the side wall. The walls, window sills, and ceiling
contained accumulations of cobwebs, dirt, and scattered hay.
Animal rooms must be kept clean and in good repair to protect the guinea pigs and prevent unnecessary disease risks.
Ineffective cleaning and housekeeping can expose the guinea pigs to health problems. Correct by ensuring the animal
premises are kept clean, including: sweeping the floor on a regular basis; removing clutter and trash from the animal
room; storing equipment, cardboard boxes and supplies off the floor; removing cobwebs, loose hay from walls, ceiling,
and widow sills; and maintaining a general cleanliness to support good animal husbandry and health.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
